DataElement.preferredName: OMRS Oral Cavity Change Range Score Five Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric rating of the amount of oral mucosal change in centimeters squared using a five point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: OMRS Oral Cavity Change Range Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease._The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease.

Concepts.definition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for CCR per approval by P.Asangong. mc 3/5/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: OMRS Range Score Five Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Oral Mucositis Rating Scale Range Score Five Point Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
